summary:
Senet is an ancient Egyptian game board found in the Brooklyn Museum. It was made for King Amenhotep III over 3,000 years ago. The game is played on a board with 30 squares and has special pieces. It was popular in ancient Egypt and often had religious meanings.

# Games: A Universal Fun

Games are fun activities with rules. They can be played alone or with others, and sometimes even for an audience. Games have goals, challenges, and interactions. They can be simple or complex and have been around for thousands of years, with ancient games like Senet, Mancala, and the Royal Game of Ur.
title: Game
